newsitem.title: GERMANY: RWE expects telecoms break-even around 2000.
newsitem.headline: RWE expects telecoms break-even around 2000.

text.p: German diversified utility RWE AG expects its telecommunications business to break-even around the year 2000, the group said at its annual results conference on Tuesday.
"We reckon that we will see break-even around the year 2000," management board chairman Dietmar Kuhnt told journalists.
The company said earlier it expected higher losses in its fledgling telecommunications business in the current business year.
Start-up losses had been factored in to the group's strategy and would be higher in the 1996/1997 year, RWE said in a statement prepared for delivery at a news conference.
In the 1995/96 business year, the group saw turnover in its telecoms business of around 500 million marks, with losses of 75 million marks in the period.

Kuhnt said that contracts for the planned telecoms joint venture with German utility Veba AG and the British telecoms company Cable & Wireless would be signed this year, although a date for the signing was yet to be set.

RWE took the markets by surprise earlier this month when it said it was pulling out of a German telecoms alliance with British Telecom and fellow diversified utility Viag AG due to differences over market strategy.
